# License Whitelist for SecPal Dependencies
#
# This file lists all licenses that are compatible with AGPL-3.0-or-later
# and may be used as dependencies in SecPal projects.
#
# Usage:
#   - CI/CD checks verify all dependencies against this whitelist
#   - npm: license-checker --onlyAllow "$(cat .github/license-whitelist.txt | grep -v '^#' | tr '\n' ';')"
#   - composer: Custom script to parse composer licenses output
#
# Format: One SPDX License Identifier per line
# Reference: https://spdx.org/licenses/

# ============================================================================
# PERMISSIVE LICENSES (Fully Compatible)
# ============================================================================

MIT
BSD-2-Clause
BSD-3-Clause
Apache-2.0
ISC
0BSD
Unlicense
WTFPL

# ============================================================================
# WEAK COPYLEFT LICENSES (Compatible for Linking)
# ============================================================================

LGPL-2.0-or-later
LGPL-2.1
LGPL-2.1-or-later
LGPL-3.0
LGPL-3.0-or-later
MPL-1.1
MPL-2.0
EPL-1.0
EPL-2.0
CDDL-1.0
CDDL-1.1

# ============================================================================
# STRONG COPYLEFT LICENSES (Same Family, Compatible)
# ============================================================================

GPL-2.0-or-later
GPL-3.0
GPL-3.0-or-later
AGPL-3.0
AGPL-3.0-or-later

# ============================================================================
# PUBLIC DOMAIN / CC0 (Fully Compatible)
# ============================================================================

CC0-1.0
CC-PDDC

# ============================================================================
# SPECIAL CASES (Case-by-case Review)
# ============================================================================

# Python Software Foundation License
PSF-2.0
Python-2.0

# Zlib License (permissive, game engines)
Zlib

# Boost Software License (permissive)
BSL-1.0

# OpenSSL License (permissive with attribution)
OpenSSL

# ============================================================================
# INCOMPATIBLE LICENSES (DO NOT USE)
# ============================================================================
#
# These licenses are NOT in the whitelist and will fail CI checks:
#
# GPL-2.0-only          - Incompatible with AGPL-3.0
# Proprietary           - No source code
# Commercial            - Paid license
# CC-BY-*               - Not for software (content only)
# CC-BY-SA-*            - Not for software (content only)
# CC-BY-NC-*            - Non-commercial restriction
# JSON                  - "Evil" clause (not OSI approved)
#
# ============================================================================

# ============================================================================
# AUTOMATED CHECK CONFIGURATION
# ============================================================================
#
# npm/package.json:
#   Add to package.json scripts:
#   "license-check": "license-checker --onlyAllow 'MIT;BSD-2-Clause;BSD-3-Clause;Apache-2.0;ISC;0BSD;Unlicense;WTFPL;LGPL-2.1-or-later;LGPL-3.0-or-later;MPL-2.0;GPL-3.0-or-later;AGPL-3.0-or-later;CC0-1.0;PSF-2.0;Zlib;BSL-1.0;OpenSSL'"
#
# composer/composer.json:
#   composer licenses --format=json | jq -r '.packages[].license[]' | sort -u
#   Then manually verify against this whitelist
#
# GitHub Actions Workflow:
#   - name: Check Dependency Licenses
#     run: |
#       npm run license-check || true
#       composer licenses
#
# ============================================================================
